flawed_nl_solution:
If Matthews has 60 cows, Aaron has 4*60 = 240 cows.
Together, Aaron and Matthews have 240+60 = <<240+60=3000>>3000 cows.
Since Marovich has 30 fewer cows than the combined number of cows that Aaron and Matthews have, Marovich has 3000-30 = <<3000-30=2970>>2970 cows.
Altogether, the three have 2970+3000 = <<2970+3000=5970>>5970 cows

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 300, not 3000. It appears an extra zero was added to the number.
